data.title: fixed interactive_loader() not returning a cached scene
data.body:
As title suggests, interactive_loader() did not return cached resource and returned null object in gdscript. Can be reproduced by loading same scene twice, and this patch seems to work just fine.

P.S. created new fork because couldn't rebase it properly, old conversation here #4867

data.title: Regular editor freezes
data.body:
Windows 10, Godot 2.0.3, 64 bits

I am regularly getting freezes with the editor.
Unfortunately I've not been able to find a reproduction yet, and I cannot attach the C++ debugger because it says "only external code is executing" (Visual Studio).
There are no errors in the console.

So far, here is what I was doing for a few occurences of the freeze:
- Saving a scene, Godot froze at the loading popup
- Writing code
- Writing code
- Saving script after writing code
- Clicking into the code editor

I used the editor for 30 minutes, and now it freezes every 2 minutes and I have to kill and restart it. Then after about 4 freezes, it continues to work normally. That's a bit random. There is not much difference in my usage between those periods, I'm writing code for animated GUI elements.

data.title: Wrong error when emitting a signal with arguments
data.body:
On Godot 2.0.3, Windows 10, 64 bits:

I connected a signal emitted with arguments to a function that has no parameters.
It resulted in this error message:

```
ERROR: Object::emit_signal: Error calling method from signal 'custom_pressed': 'Node(test.gd)::on_press_1': Expected 0 arguments.
   At: core\object.cpp:1210
```

It should print this instead:

```
[...] Expected 3 arguments [...]
```

This made me loose time not understanding the error in a large project.
Here is a reproduction project: http://zylannprods.fr/dl/godot/SignalError.zip

I have two suggestions:
- Fix the wrong error message
- Allow signal handlers to have a different number of parameters?

data.title: Remove translatable strings in comments
Translated string not showed in Project manager
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 (64bit) - Godot v2.1.alpha.custom_build

**Issue description**
I add russian translation. In Project manager text strings are empty.
In Editor all fine.
Project manager and editor use various fonts?

**Steps to reproduce:**
- [get ru_RU.po from my branch](https://github.com/xevinbox/godot/blob/ru_translation/tools/translations/ru_RU.po)
- build
- run
- see buttons without text in Project Manager

data.title: Go to implementation in script editor (FP)
data.body:
Ability to jump to the implementation of highlighted function. Search -> Goto Function is similar, but it would be good to have list of functions always on eyes. Of course, this would take some space and that's not good, but @kirilledelman had a great proposal: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2732#issuecomment-188399166 @puppetmaster had also a good idea worth considering: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2732#issuecomment-189003701

This is a separate issue from the big list #2982

data.title: Highlight unused variables
data.body:
NetBeans IDE is able to track down unused variables and highlight them. They are underlined and the tooltip is shown after a while on cursor hover. This feature should be very subtle.

This is a separate issue from the big list #2982
![unused](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3484686/15635214/b799765c-25d8-11e6-898d-9722cb6dfb54.jpg)

data.title: Multiline text cursor in script editor
data.body:
Cursor in script editor is able to point to more lines. When you write something, it is written on those lines simultaneously. Good reference could be this [Atom package](https://atom.io/packages/multi-cursor). As pigments #4882, this is especially usefull in web development so I'm not sure, how usefull this feature would be for game developers. Thus further discussion is welcome.

This is a separate issue from the big list #2982

data.title: Fix: Should never call cast_to on a NULL object
data.body:
- There may be other places I'm missing where cast should be checked. But the
  main spot for bug #4673 is taken care of at:  scene/main/viewport.cpp:2089

Ticket:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/4673

data.title: Show colors in script editor - pigments
data.body:
Atom editor has a neat plugin called [pigments](https://github.com/abe33/atom-pigments). It highlights the color declaration with the declared color. This is especially usefull in web development so I'm not sure, how usefull this feature would be for game developers. Thus further discussion is welcome.

This is a separate issue from the big list #2982

![pigments](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3484686/15635045/57e8cc48-25d4-11e6-9faf-10453d29933d.jpg)

data.title: Code minimap
data.body:
Some text editors and IDEs have a code preview (minimap) next to the editor. It's very helpful, when you work with huge script. But it also clutters the view, so it should be optional feature. Minimap could also highlight selected word, that would be neat. But even a simple minimap would be just fine.

This is a separate issue from the big list #2982

![Atom editor](https://ugotsta.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/atom-minimap-highlight.png)

data.title: Add magnetometer support for iOS
data.body: Since magnetometer sensor support was added to Android (#4845), it remains the task to add such support for iOS.

data.title: Project manager does not use the editor font settings
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Arch Linux 64bit - Godot 2.1alpha compiled with 0a046e6232cd6dc094423436da8bc1842a8e2645
**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Project manager window and script editor can't display Chinese characters

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Clean custom fonts of editor and script editor in editor settings.
2. Set editor language to zh_CN.
3. Restart editor.

data.title: Error when Playing .ogv Video
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot_v2.0.3_stable_win64.exe

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When importing a `ogv` video file, and then previewing, an unexpected error returns and freezes the app, with this error:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10387670/15634662/54fc1194-257e-11e6-9c83-741948c60666.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Add Video Player Node
- Load attached video file to Video Player Node
- Play Scene

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[ogv bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/288424/ogv.bug.zip)

**Edit:** Just tested it with an .ogm file too, same result

data.title: Editor crashes when clearing DynamicFontData resource
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Arch Linux, Godot 2.1 Git (https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/3e8eb396d7cfec8a96efb78719c0556f1beccf68)

Compiler: `gcc (GCC) 6.1.1 20160501`

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
- Create a Label
- Set a custom DynamicFont for it
- Try creating a new DynamicFontData resource (not loading an existing one)
- Clear it, because you realize you probably wanted to load one instead
- Editor crashes

data.title: x11: Add support for filesystem drag & drop using xdnd
data.body:
Accepting only the `text/uri-list` type for now, as it seemed the most common to me.

Tested with the following File managers:
- Dolphin
- Thunar
- Whatever the e20 one is called

and these DEs:
- KDE Plasma 5.6
- Cinnamon
- Enlightenment

All on Arch Linux, kernel 4.5, Xorg 18.3

~~The only one that didn't work was Nemo (on all WMs)... it seems not to send XdndEnter events to our window. I have no idea what's happening there yet.~~ **Edit:** Nemo works now, as does PCManFM

data.title: [REQUEST] allow closing bracket straight away in script
data.body:
just a simple request, but when typing out the code, it does allow the opening bracket `(`, but no closing one. it would be good if both came up and your caret was inbetween to continue coding

thanks

data.title: Translation on X scales instead of moving in the 3D editor
data.body:
Godot v. 2.03 stable, Win x64

While moving a node along the X axis in the 3D editor with the move tool, if the middle mouse button is clicked to change the constrain mode, that first switch makes scaling be applied instead. Doesn't happen on other axes nor under other constrain modes.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Select and object.
2. Pick the move tool.
3. Start dragging over the X axis arrow.
4. While still holding the LMB, click the MMB.
5. Note that now moving the mouse will produce (proportional) scaling instead of translation.

data.title: Add Simplified Chinese translation
data.body:
Fill about 80% translation.

Rest part may finished by others or another day :)

data.title: Axis-constrained transform message out of phase in 3D editor
data.body:
Godot v. 2.03 stable, Win x64

When moving or rotating a node in the 3D editor (yet with the select tool or the move or rotate tools), while cycling between different modes of axis constraining (middle mouse button), the message informing about the current mode reflects the previous.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Select and object.
2. Pick the move tool.
3. Start dragging over the Y or Z-axis arrow. *
4. While still holding the LMB, click the MMB.
5. Note that each time MMB is clicked, the message tells about the constrain mode formerly active instead of the current one.

~~*: X axis yeilds to another issue, explained in a separate report.~~ **Edit:** the other issue looks already fixed.

data.title: ShaderGraph nodes position reset when deleting connected nodes
data.body:
When making a shader with ShaderGraph and deleting a node that's already connected to the chain, sometimes all other nodes reset their position and "stick" to the cursor (often fail to do so). 
For example, after deleting one of the nodes here, RGB operator stuck to the cursor and moves with a pointer, but it's position is way too far from the pointer. 
These little glitches are not consistent but occur way too often and ruin the whole structure sometimes. 
![clearcolor10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/15632356/8fa96a76-2597-11e6-806a-1ceb08ff87fc.png)
